thread.title: Ohio toddler rescued: Missing 2-days, found covered in flies sleeping in grass
thread.title_full: Ohio toddler rescued: Missing 2-days, found covered in flies sleeping in grass | Examiner.com

author: Roz Zurko
title: Ohio toddler rescued: Missing 2-days, found covered in flies sleeping in grass
text:
The Ohio toddler who wandered away from her home Friday was rescued by one of the searchers. She was found sleeping in tall grass, not far from her home. YouTube screen shot An Ohio toddler was rescued two days after she was reported missing from her North Bloomfield, Ohio, home. The man who rescued the 2-year-old toddler was one of the volunteers from the many search parties looking or the child. He gave the 911 operator “goose bumps” when calling in with the news that he had just found the toddler, reports NBC News on October 5.
You can hear the 911 operator say she has "goose bumps" after she heard Rainn Peterson crying in the background. The emotional call was enough to bring tears to anyone’s eyes. Rainn was sleeping when the member of the volunteer search team came upon her. He told the 911 operator that she was covered in flies , but otherwise she seemed fine. She could be heard crying in the background.
According to KHOU News 11 , the volunteer searcher found Rainn curled up in the tall grass sleeping. Rainn was first reported missing by her great grandparents at around 7:30 p.m. on Friday. She didn't have any shoes or socks on and wasn't wearing a coat, reports indicate today.
On the call you can hear the man say to Rainn, "I'm coming honey...You're okay, sweetheart. I swear you're gonna be okay." Rainn could still be heard crying in the background through the 911 taped call.
The female dispatcher then says, "Is that her I hear? OK, I hear her. Oh, I just got goosebumps." Then the man answers her with, "Oh my God, me too." He continued with, "I couldn't give up on this kid. Thank God." At one point he asks the 911 operator if he can approach the little girl and pick her up.
You can tell he didn't want to scare the child. When the other members of this massive search party got a text message saying the toddler had been found alive and well, there was a lot of crying, all from joy! Rainn is in he hospital listed in stable condition as doctors check out the little toddler who was on her own for two days.
Rainn went missing from her home on Friday where she was last seeing playing with her siblings, reports KHOU News. Rainn's mother talked with the media and said that she had been out with her boyfriend and her grandparents were watching the kids. She and her three children were staying with her grandparents while she was getting ready to move into an apartment.
The toddler's mother said that her grandmother was cooking dinner in the kitchen and the three kids were with her grandfather downstairs when the toddler went upstairs and apparently wandered off. She said she was at a tattoo parlor with her boyfriend when she got the call from her grandmother that her daughter, Rainn was missing.
